clinical_note.text: Patient is a 45-year-old female presenting with a palpable neck lump first noticed by her hairdresser during an appointment 10 days ago. Patient is currently asymptomatic, denying dysphagia, dyspnea, or voice changes. On physical exam, a firm, non-tender, approximately 2cm nodule is noted in the right lower pole of the thyroid. No cervical lymphadenopathy noted. Given the firm nature of the nodule, we must r/o thyroid malignancy. Plan includes serum TSH and a Thyroid Ultrasound for further characterization.

results.full_text: TSH: 1.25 mIU/L (Reference Range: 0.40 - 4.50 mIU/L). Result within normal limits.

diagnostic_hypothesis.reasoning: Palpable thyroid nodules in adult females carry a risk of malignancy; physical examination findings of a firm nodule necessitate imaging regardless of normal thyroid function tests.

failure_mode: Ultrasound delayed due to administrative insurance denial
ai_should_flag: High-risk diagnostic order pending for 28 days
Administrative insurance denial for rule-out malignancy order
Closed-loop failure for palpable thyroid nodule investigation
